alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 1:35PM EDT until May 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EDT FOR TALBOT...CENTRAL QUEEN ANNE`S...SOUTHWESTERN CAROLINE AND WESTERN KENT COUNTIES... At 134 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stevensville to 7 miles southwest of Oxford, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Chestertown, Centreville, Rock Hall, Trappe, St. Michaels, Church Hill, Preston, Oxford, Queen Anne, Old Town, Grasonville, Starr, Copperville, Jumptown, Choptank, Windyhill and Tanyard. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
